intro: Gnaphalium lancifolium, commonly known as slender leaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium lancifolium is also known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
